name: Jpindar.GitHub.io
body:
Jeanne M. Pindar  
4 Page Lane, Hampton Beach NH  
603-205-2159  
jeannepindar@gmail.com  
  
---
EMPLOYMENT  
SimWave RF & Microwave Design      Mar 2015 - present  
microwave equipment manufacturer  
Designed and programmed microcontroller boards, drew schematics and laid out PCBs,
specified and purchased electronic components, circuit boards and subassemblies,
built prototypes, tested active microwave filter circuits

Bartley Machine Co. Amesbury MA 	Nov. 2006 - Jan. 2015  
Active filter manufacturer  
Designed digital circuits including microcontroller boards,
designed PIC processor based embedded systems and wrote firmware in C,
drew schematics and laid out PCBs, specified and purchased electronic components, circuit boards and subassemblies,
tested active microwave filter circuits; wrote ATE and other desktop software to control products and instrumentation via rs-232, IEEE-488 etc.

Marine MD, Merrimack NH         Apr. 2005 - May 2006  
Small boat repair and rebuilding startup  
Installed marine electronics such as radios and antennas; rewired electrical circuits; performed engine repair and maintenance

Micronetics Inc., Hudson NH (now part of Mercury Systems)	 Jun. 1999 - Apr. 2005  
Manufacturer of microwave signal processing devices  
Designed, programmed, and implemented instrument control systems using PC's, embedded 
computers, and various GPIB and serial instrumentation;
tested and calibrated active microwave devices using network analyzers, spectrum analyzers, oscilloscopes, power meters and other instruments;
wrote firmware (in C and assembler) used in microcontroller based products;
wrote software (GUI, ATE etc.) in Pascal and Visual Basic, ported software from HP Basic and other obsolete languages,
wrote Acceptance Test Procedures;

American Fibertek Inc., Somerset NJ	Feb. 1994 - Jun. 1999  
Manufacturer of fiber optic video and data transmission systems  
Tested, tuned, troubleshot (to component level) and repaired transceiver circuits including fm modulators and demodulators, video amplifiers, and laser diode drivers;
installed and polished fiber optic connectors

Vectronics Microwave Corporation, Middlesex NJ (now part of Mercury Systems)  Aug. 1985 - Mar. 1993  
Manufacturer of custom mil-spec microwave signal processing devices  
Designed, programmed, and implemented ATE systems using PC's, Hewlett Packard computers, and various HPIB and analog instruments;
tested and calibrated active microwave devices using network and spectrum analyzers, oscilloscopes, and other instruments;
designed, prototyped, tested and repaired (to component level) various digital and analog circuits such as computer interface circuits (IEEE-488, RS-232-C, etc.), amplifiers, and voltage controlled oscillators;
designed and wrote software for Basic Stamp based devices,
wrote engineering software in various languages;
created CAD drawings;
built phase-matched semirigid coaxial cables

GMI Electronics Inc., Plainfield NJ	Jan. 1985 - Aug. 1985  
Electronics manufacturer  
Managed a multi-user UNIX-based minicomputer system;
installed and configured terminals and printers and cabling;
created database programs using dBase II;
trained personnel in computer use

Conolog Corporation, Branchburg NJ	Jan. 1984 - Dec. 1984  
Manufacturer of RF modules for military communications  
Tested and tuned filters and other LCR networks;
built test fixtures;
programmed Hewlett Packard microcomputers (using HPL and HPIL) to control network analyzers and other instruments

EDUCATION

Trenton State College, Trenton NJ, majored in Physics  
University of Scranton, Scranton PA, majored in Engineering Science
